news_header: Sirpa Pietkäinen aims to address the climate crisis by regulating pension companies' investments, which currently include significant fossil fuel holdings.
news_text: Sirpa Pietkäinen, a long-term member of the European Parliament, is advocating for increased regulation of pension companies to combat the climate crisis. In an interview, she highlighted that Finnish pension firms hold around EUR 70 billion in fossil fuel investments. Experts from various pension companies, including Ilmarinen and Varma, discussed the importance of sustainability regulations and their commitment to reducing fossil fuel investments by 2025 and 2030, respectively. They emphasized that while regulations are increasing, the focus should also be on the financial viability of sustainable investments.
